channel.title: Python on Rihad Variawa
channel.description: Recent content in Python on Rihad Variawa

item.title: Build A Simple Blockchain
item.description: Intro & Background Blockchain is a data structure that was first introduced by Satoshi Nakamoto in the Bitcoin protocol white paper a decade ago. Bitcoin’s blockchain stores transaction data, but we can store any type of data in a blockchain. Ethereum, for example, enables users to store code snippets called ‘smart contracts’ in their blockchain. In this project, I build a simple blockchain in Python that uses proof-of-work consensus, just like the Bitcoin protocol does.

item.title: Password Detection Strength
item.description: Intro & Background A function written that uses regular expressions to make sure the password string it is passed is strong. A strong password is defined as one that is at least eight characters long, contains both uppercase and lowercase characters, and has at least one digit. You may need to test the string against multiple regex patterns to validate its strength. Data Explain the source of the data and include the URL to the data.

item.title: A Simple Blockchain
item.description: Build a simple blockchain in under 5 minutes.
